experience: You and Micky both know Curtis Gunn, Keith Weiner, and 20 others

• Led The Spirit Project in the transition of the software development for proprietary web-based enterprise system from outside web development firm to in-house agile development team working 3 shifts providing 24 hours/day development resulting a 99.81% uptime for 2015 and 100% uptime in 2016.• Worked closely with Dawson McAllister Association’s leadership team to overhaul aging technology infrastructure for the $5,000,000/year non-profit with 43 team members• Co-founded Jennex, LLC with Texas-based private equity firm to build and deploy web-based application that within first 12 months served 540 call center agents processing over 34,000 transactions
Co-Founder, Board Director, Chief Executive Officer, Chief Information Officer
Tucson, Arizona; Phoenix, Arizona and Portland, Oregon

Micky, along with co-founders Jarret Hamstreet and Cody Nicholls, launched Post.Bid.Ship., Inc. in 2010. After serving as the company's first Chief Executive Officer, Micky stepped down in August 2013 welcoming twins to his family and transitioning to the role of Fractional CIO/CTO.• Secured $2,800,000 to launch and grow online commercial freight market place to allow trucking firms and freight brokerages to bid on commercial shippers’ and third party logistic planners commercial freight.• Increased company valuation as Chief Executive Officer from initial pre-money value of $1,260,000 in July 2010 to post-money of Series A3 round of $6,744,219 in June 2013 (435% increase, 145% APR).• Received two Arizona Innovation Grants totaling $371,000, named Arizona’s Top 8 Most Innovative Start-ups by State Governor and named top 14 Southwest companies by Invest Southwest.• Spun-out subsidiary freight brokerage TruckItNow that by 2015 generated revenue of over $3,000,000/year.• Named by Grubb & Ellis along with Post.Bid.Ship. co-founder Jarret Hamstreet as the 2012 Southern Arizona Emergent Entrepreneurs of the Year.• Recruited and managed international development team that took product from concept to market using agile programming methodologies. • Oversaw product design and development by working closely with our enterprise clients to implement a continuous feedback system that provided our team the ability to innovate and react to a rapidly evolving market quickly.•  Established strategic technology integration partnerships with other major enterprise software manufacturers using our Open Application Programming Interface (API's) to extend our product into their client bases.•  Developed Post.Bid.Ship. BConn technology giving Oracle Transportation Management users their first-ever access to a fully integrated freight marketplace. Along with BConn, Post.Bid.Ship. also achieved the Oracle Validated Integration (OVI) and Oracle Gold Partner Certification.
University of Arizona, Eller College of Management

• Thomas R. Brown Foundation Fellowship and Scholarship Award, 2008• The University of Arizona Graduate Assistantship - 2008-2010• The University of Arizona McGuire Center for Entrepreneurship Best New Venture, 2010

recommendations: Karissa Hanson-Morris
President at Virtual Works
October 16, 2015, Karissa reported directly to Micky

I consider myself quite fortunate to have worked with Micky and have benefitted greatly from my time as his Virtual Executive Assistant. Micky is skilled at leading teams and creating an environment where all staff can be their most successful. Team members benefit from Micky’s thoughtful but direct coaching and mentoring as well as the replicable processes and systems he puts into place to create consistency, efficiency, and high quality. Micky is very knowledgeable in a wide variety of areas and freely shares his expertise for the benefit of others. He has the ability and drive to quickly become an expert on any topic and uses this knowledge to make excellent business decisions and create high quality solutions and products. Client satisfaction is a top priority for Micky. His excellent project management ensures that each client knows they are valued and guarantees their needs are met in a timely manner and to their full satisfaction. He is a masterful communicator. He goes beyond just constructing highly technical issues into clear and graspable language. He clearly articulates key factors and provides well-informed options to guide in decision-making. His timely and skillfully crafted responses to client questions and concerns ensures there is never any ambiguity regarding final outcomes and that clients have full understanding and confidence in the results. Micky is guided by well-developed internal principles resulting in top-notch end products, exceptional working relationships, and the highest business and personal ethics. He is someone with whom you always feel grateful to be working.
Karissa Hanson-Morris
President at Virtual Works

Principal at Golden Barrel Advisors, LLC
March 7, 2015, Jarret managed Micky directly

It is my great pleasure to write this reference for Micky Thompson.  I met Micky seven years ago when we entered The University of Arizona’s Eller MBA program.  I was immediately drawn to Micky’s candid personality, strong moral compass and “Southern Charm” – all attributes that served Micky well during our time as MBA students and later as business partners at Post.Bid.Ship.From day one of our MBA studies, Micky proved to be a valuable asset to our MBA class.  He brought to class discussions insightful commentary informed by his decade long pre-MBA career as a technology entrepreneur.  As second year MBA students, Micky and I partnered as teammates in the nationally ranked McGuire Center for Entrepreneurship where we developed the venture concept that later became Post.Bid.Ship.  Shortly before graduation, Micky and I, along with our teammate Cody Nicholls, proudly shared The University of Arizona’s “Best Venture Award” for our Post.Bid.Ship. concept.Upon graduation from The University of Arizona, Micky and I co-founded Post.Bid.Ship., Inc. with the encouragement of our family, friends and startup investors.  Micky served as Post.Bid.Ship.’s founding CEO during which time he led the company through the important product development and go-to-market stages.  Micky’s blend of business and technology experience enabled us to navigate these early stages of the company’s lifecycle, identify key market opportunities on which to focus our limited resources and overcome challenges commonly encountered by technology startups.During Micky’s tenure as CEO, Post.Bid.Ship. achieved major milestones, including bringing our product to market, filing the company’s first patent application, raising over $2 million from private investors, securing grants of $371,000 as a two-time winner of the Arizona Innovation Challenge and being named one of the Southwest’s most innovative companies by the Invest Southwest conference.  Throughout this time, Micky worked hard to nurture a well-informed team and invested a great deal of energy in communicating our goals and action plan to company stakeholders, including board members, investors, employees, customers and partners.After three years as Post.Bid.Ship.’s CEO, Micky stepped into the role of Chief Information Officer, a move that enabled the company to continue benefitting from his technology leadership and enabled Micky the flexibility to focus on increasing family responsibilities.  As Micky’s successor as CEO, I continue to benefit from his business acumen, counsel on important technology issues and strategic vision as a member of the company’s Board of Directors.  I look forward to sharing with Micky many successes still to come at Post.Bid.Ship. and to observing with great interest other organizations he chooses to apply his considerable entrepreneurial skillset to in the years ahead.
Jarret Hamstreet
Principal at Golden Barrel Advisors, LLC
March 7, 2015, Jarret managed Micky directly

I had the opportunity to sit under Micky's leadership while I was at The SPIRIT Project. Micky has a unique ability to turn complex problems into well thought, strategic solutions. He uses precise and effective systems that turn each of his projects into well oiled machines that produce results. Micky intentionally shares his wisdom and experience with his teams, making everyone around him better. As much as Micky teaches others, he's also extremely teachable, making him a humble leader that becomes more valuable to an organization every day.

I had the privilege of working with Micky during my time at the Dawson McAllister Association (DMA). Working within the web/digital department, I had the opportunity to work extensively with Micky on a weekly basis in relation to DMA's IT and technical needs. He wasn't only an innovator, but an educator. I learned an immense amount from him during my time at DMA, which ultimately laid the foundation for my career. He was always incredibly educated on any task at hand and even took on the task of creating a custom CRM for the entire organization. I would gladly take the chance to work with him again and would undoubtedly recommend him as a business partner.

Jarret Hamstreet
Principal at Golden Barrel Advisors, LLC
March 6, 2015, Jarret worked with Micky in the same group

As I write this reference for Jarret, the companies we founded together, Post.Bid.Ship. and its subsidiary TruckItNow, are turning 5-years-old. Given that we started both companies during one of the United States’ deepest recessions in history, we are both very proud to have achieved this milestone. Next year will also mark the beginning of Jarret’s 3rd year as the companies’ Chief Executive Officer.As the prior CEO for the companies, I was fortunate to have Jarret serve with me as our Chief Operations Officer and member of our Board of Directors. During this tenure, Jarret showed great talent and leadership. As our COO, he was instrumental in the opening and growing of our profitable subsidiary TruckItNow, helping Post.Bid.Ship. win 2 innovation grants totaling over $370,000 as well as helping us raise over $2.3 million in investor funding. Also under Jarret’s leadership, Post.Bid.Ship. was named one of the top 8 most innovative companies in Arizona and again the following year one of the top 6 by the Governor’s office. We even received recognition outside of Arizona as Post.Bid.Ship. was named one of the top 14 Southwest companies by the Invest Southwest organization.  Since becoming CEO 2 years ago allowing me to spend more time with my growing family, Jarret has made smart moves including the relocation of the company to Phoenix, Arizona to be in a better position to attract top talent, aggressively grow our subsidiary TruckItNow and form valuable integration partnerships with other technology firms to expand the reach of Post.Bid.Ship.  There is a common belief among angel and venture capital investors that the best entrepreneurs are coachable and amendable and Jarret embodies those highly sought after traits. Jarret knows the importance and value in seeking wise counsel, surrounding oneself with smart people, actively listening, gathering feedback from all stakeholders, making a decision and sticking to a plan until new information that would alter the course presents itself. Prior to co-founding Post.Bid.Ship. and TruckItNow with Jarret, I was also fortunate to attend The University of Arizona MBA Program with him and work together as we completed the highly respected McGuire Center for Entrepreneurship Program as part of our MBA studies. Upon graduation, the thesis we created together as part of the program’s requirements would help us win The University of Arizona’s Best Venture Award our graduating year and put us in the position to officially launch Post.Bid.Ship. Two years after launching the company, Jarret and I were both honored to be named Southern Arizona’s Emerging Entrepreneurs of the Year for our work at Post.Bid.Ship.  In closing, I consider Jarret to be a great business person, talented entrepreneur, thoughtful person and close friend and I look forward to celebrating the many successes I am sure he will achieve over his lifetime.
Jarret Hamstreet
Principal at Golden Barrel Advisors, LLC

Principal at Golden Barrel Advisors, LLC

As I write this reference for Jarret, the companies we founded together, Post.Bid.Ship. and its subsidiary TruckItNow, are turning 5-years-old. Given that we started both companies during one of the United States’ deepest recessions in history, we are both very proud to have achieved this milestone. Next year will also mark the beginning of Jarret’s 3rd year as the companies’ Chief Executive Officer.As the prior CEO for the companies, I was fortunate to have Jarret serve with me as our Chief Operations Officer and member of our Board of Directors. During this tenure, Jarret showed great talent and leadership. As our COO, he was instrumental in the opening and growing of our profitable subsidiary TruckItNow, helping Post.Bid.Ship. win 2 innovation grants totaling over $370,000 as well as helping us raise over $2.3 million in investor funding. Also under Jarret’s leadership, Post.Bid.Ship. was named one of the top 8 most innovative companies in Arizona and again the following year one of the top 6 by the Governor’s office. We even received recognition outside of Arizona as Post.Bid.Ship. was named one of the top 14 Southwest companies by the Invest Southwest organization.  Since becoming CEO 2 years ago allowing me to spend more time with my growing family, Jarret has made smart moves including the relocation of the company to Phoenix, Arizona to be in a better position to attract top talent, aggressively grow our subsidiary TruckItNow and form valuable integration partnerships with other technology firms to expand the reach of Post.Bid.Ship.  There is a common belief among angel and venture capital investors that the best entrepreneurs are coachable and amendable and Jarret embodies those highly sought after traits. Jarret knows the importance and value in seeking wise counsel, surrounding oneself with smart people, actively listening, gathering feedback from all stakeholders, making a decision and sticking to a plan until new information that would alter the course presents itself. Prior to co-founding Post.Bid.Ship. and TruckItNow with Jarret, I was also fortunate to attend The University of Arizona MBA Program with him and work together as we completed the highly respected McGuire Center for Entrepreneurship Program as part of our MBA studies. Upon graduation, the thesis we created together as part of the program’s requirements would help us win The University of Arizona’s Best Venture Award our graduating year and put us in the position to officially launch Post.Bid.Ship. Two years after launching the company, Jarret and I were both honored to be named Southern Arizona’s Emerging Entrepreneurs of the Year for our work at Post.Bid.Ship.  In closing, I consider Jarret to be a great business person, talented entrepreneur, thoughtful person and close friend and I look forward to celebrating the many successes I am sure he will achieve over his lifetime.

summary: Experienced technology executive with a proven track record for helping organizations deliver ideas to market. Micky brings a wealth of knowledge gained through hands-on experience managing projects, developing products, building teams and leading organizations to the next level. Micky possesses product management and agile software development experience managing 39 full-time onshore and offshore software developers working a total of 76,427 hours on multiple and often simultaneous software projects. Micky has also lead technology teams dedicated to managing the maintenance, deployment, upgrade and overhaul of several corporate technology systems.
